meanings.definition: A person or entity that has exclusive control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The monopolizer of the lemonade stand was the only one selling drinks at the fair.
meanings.sent2: The tech giant became a monopolizer in the industry, dominating the market with its products.
meanings.sent3: The monopolizer of cookies in the office always had a full jar on their desk.
meanings.sent4: She was a monopolizer of attention, always being the center of every conversation.
meanings.sent5: The monopolizer of the remote control refused to share it with anyone else.

meanings.definition: To gain exclusive possession or control of something.
meanings.sent1: He tried to monopolizer the toy store by buying out all the competition.
meanings.sent2: The company aimed to monopolizer the market by offering unique services.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cat was trying to monopolizer all the sunlight in the house.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to monopolizer the art scene with their innovative techniques.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious entrepreneur wanted to monopolizer the industry with their groundbreaking idea.
